Class UpdateDonationInfoController

java.lang.Object

public class UpdateDonationInfoController
extends DonationInfoController
This controller class is for updating the Donation information. The class extends on the DonationInfoController Class.

    • getLoc

      public void getLoc()
      Method for getting the getting the location details for a donation details. catch block for handling the exception due to potential null entries.
      Overrides:
      getLoc in class DonationInfoController

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This is the initializing function of the fxml components. When a the window is launched this method initializes these components. Establishes the connection with the database and upon fetching the data columns works with the property values.
      Overrides:
      initialize in class DonationInfoController

    • checkAlert

      public boolean checkAlert()
      This is for the checking alert while updating the information.
      Returns:
      boolean, returns true value if there is an alert and returns false if otherwise.

    • pressUpdateDonation

      public void pressUpdateDonation​(javafx.event.ActionEvent even) throws java.io.IOException
      Method for the Updated donation button. Loads the sample.DonationInfo.fxml file. Establishes the connection with the database and overwrites them Using DML into the database.
      Parameters:
      even - , object of ActionEvent class
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • pressBack

      public void pressBack​(javafx.event.ActionEvent even) throws java.io.IOException
      This method is here for the functionality of the "Back" button. This will redirect the user to the parent node that is the "root" which is sample.UserPanel.fxml. This hierarchical structure is for the simplicity of the system.
      Overrides:
      pressBack in class DonationInfoController
      Parameters:
      even - , object of ActionEvent generated from click or Enter
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - which is a checked exception. Used to identify errors in i/p and o/p of a particular workflow.
